answers.answer: If you don't want to discontinue the steroids, then you could put your cat on insulin injections.  Long term steroid use is WELL known to cause diabetes in humans, as well as animals.  I've also had a cat that got diabetes from steroid use.I am very shocked that your vet told you to keep your cat on an ALL fish diet.  This is not healthy for your cat at all.  This can make your cat sick.  I don't know the specifics, but my vet told me about it.  They told me that cats need land and sea protein sources.  Please, use google or yahoo, and you'll be able to see for yourself.

question: My cats started 6 months ago with diarrhea,slight weight loss and high white blood cell count. A thyroid test ruled out hyperthyroidism.  Then an ultrasound revealed inflammed lymphnodes in the stomach, She was then given only two Depo steroid shots within 4 weeks and the lymphnodes went away but not the diarrhea,the weight loss continued, the high white blood cell count too. The thought it might be IBS. The vet switched her to busimide and within  her glucose levels shot up. He told me to continue the sardines fish canned food which is high in protein to help with the diarehha but to bring her back in to check her urine for diabetes.  If the busimide gave her the high glucose levels what can I do for the lymphnodes, diarreha?
title: inflammed lymphnodes and steroids/diabetes
